questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is measuring a right triangle. If the opposite side is 3 and hypotenuse is 5, what is sin(Œ∏)?
questions.explanation: sin(Œ∏) = opposite/hypotenuse = 3/5 = 0.6. Sir Whiskersworth's measurement is precise!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington has a right triangle with adjacent side 4 and hypotenuse 5. What is cos(Œ∏)?
questions.explanation: cos(Œ∏) = adjacent/hypotenuse = 4/5 = 0.8. Lady Pawsington's calculation is spot on!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is studying a right triangle with opposite side 3 and adjacent side 4. What is tan(Œ∏)?
questions.explanation: tan(Œ∏) = opposite/adjacent = 3/4 = 0.75. Professor Tinkles has calculated the tangent perfectly!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson is investigating a 30-60-90 triangle. If the short side is 2, what is the long side?
questions.explanation: In a 30-60-90 triangle, the long side is 2 times the short side. So 2 √ó 2 = 4!

questions.explanation: sin(30¬∞) = 0.5, so Œ∏ = 30¬∞. Sir Whiskersworth has identified the angle correctly!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is studying a 30-60-90 triangle. If the hypotenuse is 6, what is the short side?
